name: Some kind of peace
description: some kind of peace is a journey of Ólafur's personal and creative growth, set against the backdrop of a chaotic world. You'll hear hints of those private experiences - sometimes even samples of the significant events themselves – woven into an album that is remarkable in its openness, and its beauty. Throughout Ólafur urges you to embrace all that life throws at you, and above all to react, and contemplate, to find your kind of peace.

name: Re:member
description: “This is my breaking out-of-a-shell album. It’s me taking the raw influences that I have from all these different musical genres and not filtering them. It explores the creative process and how one can manipulate that to get out of the circle of expectations and habit.

name: Island Songs
description: Island Songs is an audio-visual portrait of his’ home country of Iceland. At its heart this project explores the people, places and music that that are unique to this island and influence Ólafur as an artist. Over the course of seven weeks, he travels to seven very different locations in Iceland - one per week - to record a series of new compositions. In each location Arnalds will be collaborating with artists local to the town to create and perform a new song.

name: The Chopin Project
description: I have always loved the piano music of Frédéric Chopin, but had grown weary of the uniform and standardized perfection of recordings available and I was longing for someone to come along and try something different. And one day, on a long flight to London, I thought: why don't I do it myself? And thus, in partnership with the acclaimed German-Japanese pianist Alice Sara Ott, THE CHOPIN PROJECT was born.

name: Skissur III
description: SKISSUR III is a collection of SheetMusic featuring songs from the album re:member. It includes exclusive artwork for each song, generated by our custom built Stratus artwork software.
